GT.content: beyond a mode of Being, language before linguistics [our obsession here, in GT]
GT.linkedContent: beyond a mode of Being, language before linguistics [our obsession here, in GT]

H.content: p. anne 110 what doesn’t belong to you, highest risk. what you do not possess is what obsesses you
H.linkedContent: p. anne 110 what doesn’t belong to you, highest risk. what you do not possess is what obsesses you

SPOM.content: Marx was obsessed (obsédé) by ghosts, he harassed (harcelait) the obsession
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx was obsessed (obsédé) by ghosts, he harassed (harcelait) the obsession

SPOM.content: unheimlich: word of irreducible haunting or obsession

P(I).content: la force de hantise [that drives Derrida to Blanchot or Blanchot to Blanchot], injunction of a truth w/out truth, toujours au-delà de la fascination dont on parle à leur sujet > fascination de la loi, ce qui semble inimaginable, ou inconcevable, sinon impensable
P(I).linkedContent: la force de hantise [that drives Derrida to Blanchot or Blanchot to Blanchot], injunction of a truth w/out truth, toujours au-delà de la fascination dont on parle à leur sujet > fascination de la loi, ce qui semble inimaginable, ou inconcevable, sinon impensable

PAS.content: faire trembler d’abord (trembling, first approach): denial of fear, frightens more, a fascination, la moindre possibilité de s’arriver, in trembling one renounces mastery, use, domination, one does not know how to sign its effects > pas d’insistance distances itself on first approach
PAS.linkedContent: faire trembler d’abord (trembling, first approach): denial of fear, frightens more, a fascination, la moindre possibilité de s’arriver, in trembling one renounces mastery, use, domination, one does not know how to sign its effects > pas d’insistance distances itself on first approach

S.content: Heidegger’s doubling of “spirit” by use of quotation marks affects it w/ obsessive specter, he doesn’t shelter “spirit,” a hospitality w/ reservations, quotations call for another word unless they re-call the other under the same
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s doubling of “spirit” by use of quotation marks affects it w/ obsessive specter, he doesn’t shelter “spirit,” a hospitality w/ reservations, quotations call for another word unless they re-call the other under the same

S.content: that a spirit is force and is not force, has and does not have force, is a relation to double, a relation to haunting; Entmachtung (destitution) is inevitable (fatale), since ghost of spirit is never perceived
S.linkedContent: that a spirit is force and is not force, has and does not have force, is a relation to double, a relation to haunting; Entmachtung (destitution) is inevitable (fatale), since ghost of spirit is never perceived

POOF.content: friendship–enemy btwn logic of unconscious & logic of lie: these 2 logics can’t help but haunt each other, et de partager même le concept de cette hantise qui travaille le langage de notres temps
POOF.linkedContent: friendship–enemy btwn logic of unconscious & logic of lie: these 2 logics can’t help but haunt each other, et de partager même le concept de cette hantise qui travaille le langage de notres temps

DS.content: haunted by ghost or grafted onto arborescence of another text
DS.linkedContent: haunted by ghost or grafted onto arborescence of another text

ATIA.content: Derrida’s very early dream, obsession, before his bestiary [his texts], of an absolute hospitality (to so many animots), infinite appropriation—constituting everything thought or written w/in a zoosphere
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida’s very early dream, obsession, before his bestiary [his texts], of an absolute hospitality (to so many animots), infinite appropriation—constituting everything thought or written w/in a zoosphere

ATIA.content: Heidegger’s animal-machine, crossing-out, a figure of evil, resembles the virus that obsesses “everything I write,” quasi-animal, knows how to erase traces
ATIA.linkedContent: Heidegger’s animal-machine, crossing-out, a figure of evil, resembles the virus that obsesses “everything I write,” quasi-animal, knows how to erase traces

FS.content: Derrida links structuralist obsession w/ an anxiety (inquiétude) about (sur) language, an anxiety of (du) language and in (dans) language itself
FS.linkedContent: Derrida links structuralist obsession w/ an anxiety (inquiétude) about (sur) language, an anxiety of (du) language and in (dans) language itself

DST.content: obsessionality, re: writing, no longer clinical category
DST.linkedContent: obsessionality, re: writing, no longer clinical category

DST.content: Bataille: what forces me to write is the fear of going mad
DST.linkedContent: Bataille: what forces me to write is the fear of going mad

DST.content: question of obsession, of obsidionality, of exposure on all sides, arises w/ figure of a besieged (assiégée) power
DST.linkedContent: question of obsession, of obsidionality, of exposure on all sides, arises w/ figure of a besieged (assiégée) power

DST.content: this figure is impregnable because it has no single site, single figure
DST.linkedContent: this figure is impregnable because it has no single site, single figure

DST.content: it harasses (harcèle) out of (depuis) sa désistance all the others in turn ——traps everywhere, double bind and hyperbologic leave no way out (aucun issue)
DST.linkedContent: it harasses (harcèle) out of (depuis) sa désistance all the others in turn ——traps everywhere, double bind and hyperbologic leave no way out (aucun issue)

DST.content: must know all this to begin to think
DST.linkedContent: must know all this to begin to think

DST.content: double bind (as ending parentheses): can’t close one front w/out opening another on another side
DST.linkedContent: double bind (as ending parentheses): can’t close one front w/out opening another on another side

DST.content: thus Lacoue-Labarthe’s “style,” ethos, multiplying parentheses, rhythm of warnings, which don’t protect anyone > warning stands watch so no one will fail to expose oneself
DST.linkedContent: thus Lacoue-Labarthe’s “style,” ethos, multiplying parentheses, rhythm of warnings, which don’t protect anyone > warning stands watch so no one will fail to expose oneself

DST.content: hantise (obsessive fear), the way in which philosophy is haunted, visited, inhabited by madness > there is a domesticity of “philosophical madness”
DST.linkedContent: hantise (obsessive fear), the way in which philosophy is haunted, visited, inhabited by madness > there is a domesticity of “philosophical madness”

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: traversed from the beginning by discourse of others, “subject” does not incur a simple Spaltung (splitting) > the latter, w/ its oppositional logic (absence/position), creates obsession w/ appropriation dominating analysis of mimesis, & also its economic, political bearing
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: traversed from the beginning by discourse of others, “subject” does not incur a simple Spaltung (splitting) > the latter, w/ its oppositional logic (absence/position), creates obsession w/ appropriation dominating analysis of mimesis, & also its economic, political bearing

DST.content: for Lacoue-Labarthe [?], anyone linked to edge of madness (au bord de la folie), the autobiographical (allobiographical) adventure, and its doubles, and the other, and death, is concerned w/ rhythm (the musical obsession) (Nietzsche, Hölderlin, Rousseau, Reik, Mallarmé)
DST.linkedContent: for Lacoue-Labarthe [?], anyone linked to edge of madness (au bord de la folie), the autobiographical (allobiographical) adventure, and its doubles, and the other, and death, is concerned w/ rhythm (the musical obsession) (Nietzsche, Hölderlin, Rousseau, Reik, Mallarmé)

D.content: knife, obsessive, phallus that threatens & is threatened, la menace du coupe-papier dont saigna la tranche rouge ouvre ou érige (which the red edge bled opens or erects), thus broaching/breaching (entamant) in a stroke (d’un trait) the decision: opens mouth > operation of reading/writing
D.linkedContent: knife, obsessive, phallus that threatens & is threatened, la menace du coupe-papier dont saigna la tranche rouge ouvre ou érige (which the red edge bled opens or erects), thus broaching/breaching (entamant) in a stroke (d’un trait) the decision: opens mouth > operation of reading/writing

D.content: obsessive desire to escape due to structure of the text, obsession always textual
D.linkedContent: obsessive desire to escape due to structure of the text, obsession always textual

D.content: textuality is obsidional: undecidable process of opening/closing—no letup (sans cesse)
D.linkedContent: textuality is obsidional: undecidable process of opening/closing—no letup (sans cesse)

D.content: splayed square, triangle open on 4th side, loosens obsidionality of triangle and circle, whose ternary rhythm (Trinity, Oedipus, Dialectics) governs metaphysics
D.linkedContent: splayed square, triangle open on 4th side, loosens obsidionality of triangle and circle, whose ternary rhythm (Trinity, Oedipus, Dialectics) governs metaphysics

+R.content: what is detached from my signature, da, a piece (morceau) of the other’s name, one of the most obsessive motifs in Glas
+R.linkedContent: what is detached from my signature, da, a piece (morceau) of the other’s name, one of the most obsessive motifs in Glas

C.content: it’s difficult to resist obsidional invasion (investissement) > 2 desires of coffin deal (traitent) w/ each other for the dead man: 1) to lie in it, to make it yours, to steal it, give birth in it, calm one’s terror of alterity 2) to let it be the other’s
C.linkedContent: it’s difficult to resist obsidional invasion (investissement) > 2 desires of coffin deal (traitent) w/ each other for the dead man: 1) to lie in it, to make it yours, to steal it, give birth in it, calm one’s terror of alterity 2) to let it be the other’s

AD.content: for Levinas, the hôte is a hostage insofar as he’s a subject obsessed (thus besieged), persecuted, put into question in the place where he takes place—in election
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, the hôte is a hostage insofar as he’s a subject obsessed (thus besieged), persecuted, put into question in the place where he takes place—in election

AD.content: hostage: 1) a hôte given/received as a substitute pledge (gage) in places of power, at disposal of sovereign, hospitality w/out property, “accusation by everyone” 2) obsidium, obsidatus—condition of being captive/hostage, a state of siege, “persecuting obsession,” “responsibility for everyone” > acc. both lineages there’s a token of proof (gage) of substitution
AD.linkedContent: hostage: 1) a hôte given/received as a substitute pledge (gage) in places of power, at disposal of sovereign, hospitality w/out property, “accusation by everyone” 2) obsidium, obsidatus—condition of being captive/hostage, a state of siege, “persecuting obsession,” “responsibility for everyone” > acc. both lineages there’s a token of proof (gage) of substitution

AD.content: exceeding and obsessing the political/juridical: beyond law in the law > everything face exceeds marks demand for justice as law (law of justice must bend to itself)
AD.linkedContent: exceeding and obsessing the political/juridical: beyond law in the law > everything face exceeds marks demand for justice as law (law of justice must bend to itself)

OG.content: obsessive pressure of writing from where it’s held in check, such is the history of metaphysics > obstinate effort to cancel writing : threatens presence, proper, parole
OG.linkedContent: obsessive pressure of writing from where it’s held in check, such is the history of metaphysics > obstinate effort to cancel writing : threatens presence, proper, parole

CIR.content: I don’t have a fantasy of eradication/expropriation but a virtual, mimicked trance, painful pleasure of obsessive ideo-motor drive
CIR.linkedContent: I don’t have a fantasy of eradication/expropriation but a virtual, mimicked trance, painful pleasure of obsessive ideo-motor drive

EU.content: my obstinacy is great, compulsive, forced me to take les voies les plus détournées
EU.linkedContent: my obstinacy is great, compulsive, forced me to take les voies les plus détournées
